20.eng-name: Virtues of Prayer at Masjid Makkah and Madinah
20.ara-name: كتاب فضل الصلاة فى مسجد مكة والمدينة

hadiths.text: Narrated Quza'a: I heard Abu Said saying four words. He said, "I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) (saying the following narrative)." He had participated in twelve holy battles with the Prophet

chapter.ara-name: باب فَضْلِ الصَّلاَةِ فِي مَسْجِدِ مَكَّةَ وَالْمَدِينَةِ
chapter.eng-name: The superiority of offering As-Salat in the Mosque of Makkah and Al-Madina

hadiths.text: Narrated Abu Huraira:The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Do not set out on a journey except for three Mosques i.e. Al-Masjid-Al-Haram, the Mosque of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) , and the Mosque of Al-Aqsa, (Mosque of Jerusalem)

chapter.ara-name: باب فَضْلِ الصَّلاَةِ فِي مَسْجِدِ مَكَّةَ وَالْمَدِينَةِ
chapter.eng-name: The superiority of offering As-Salat in the Mosque of Makkah and Al-Madina

hadiths.text: Narrated Abu Huraira:Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "One prayer in my Mosque is better than one thousand prayers in any other mosque excepting Al-Masjid-Al-Haram

chapter.ara-name: باب فَضْلِ الصَّلاَةِ فِي مَسْجِدِ مَكَّةَ وَالْمَدِينَةِ
chapter.eng-name: The superiority of offering As-Salat in the Mosque of Makkah and Al-Madina

hadiths.text: Narrated Nafi`:Ibn `Umar never offered the Duha prayer except on two occasions: (1) Whenever he reached Mecca; and he always used to reach Mecca in the forenoon. He would perform Tawaf round the Ka`ba and then offer two rak`at at the rear of Maqam Ibrahim. (2) Whenever he visited Quba, for he used to visit it every Saturday. When he entered the Mosque, he disliked to leave it without offering a prayer. Ibn `Umar narrated that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to visit the Mosque of Quba (sometime) walking and (sometime) riding. And he (i.e. Ibn `Umar) used to say, "I do only what my companions used to do and I don't forbid anybody to pray at any time during the day or night except that one should not intend to pray at sunrise or sunset

chapter.eng-name: The Masjid Quba (the Mosque of Quba)

hadiths.text: Narrated `Abdullah bin Dinar:Ibn `Umar said, "The Prophet (ﷺ) used to go to the Mosque of Quba every Saturday (sometimes) walking and (sometimes) riding." `Abdullah (Ibn `Umar) used to do the same

chapter.ara-name: باب مَنْ أَتَى مَسْجِدَ قُبَاءٍ كُلَّ سَبْتٍ
chapter.eng-name: Whoever visited the mosque of Quba every Saturday

hadiths.text: Narrated Ibn `Umar:The Prophet (ﷺ) used to go to the Mosque of Quba (sometimes) walking and sometimes riding. Added Nafi` (in another narration), "He then would offer two rak`at (in the Mosque of Quba)

chapter.ara-name: باب إِتْيَانِ مَسْجِدِ قُبَاءٍ مَاشِيًا وَرَاكِبًا
chapter.eng-name: To go to the Mosque of Quba

hadiths.text: Narrated `Abdullah bin Zaid Al-Mazini:Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Between my house and the pulpit there is a garden of the gardens of Paradise

chapter.ara-name: باب فَضْلِ مَا بَيْنَ الْقَبْرِ وَالْمِنْبَرِ
chapter.eng-name: The superiority of the place between the pulpit and the grave (of the Prophet (ﷺ))

hadiths.text: Narrated Abu Huraira:The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Between my house and my pulpit there is a garden of the gardens of Paradise, and my pulpit is on my fountain tank (i.e. Al-Kauthar)

chapter.ara-name: باب فَضْلِ مَا بَيْنَ الْقَبْرِ وَالْمِنْبَرِ
chapter.eng-name: The superiority of the place between the pulpit and the grave (of the Prophet (ﷺ))

hadiths.text: Narrated Qaza'a Maula:(freed slave of) Ziyad: I heard Abu Sa`id Al-khudri narrating four things from the Prophet (ﷺ) and I appreciated them very much. He said, conveying the words of the Prophet. (1) "A woman should not go on a two day journey except with her husband or a Dhi-Mahram. (2) No fasting is permissible on two days: `Id-ul-Fitr and `Id-ul-Adha. (3) No prayer after two prayers, i.e. after the Fajr prayer till the sunrises and after the `Asr prayer till the sun sets. (4) Do not prepare yourself for a journey except to three Mosques, i.e. Al-Masjid-Al-Haram, the Mosque of Aqsa (Jerusalem) and my Mosque
